item.title: Genshin Impact: Bishui Plain Geoculus Locations
item.description:
Liyue is not always the easiest place to explore in Genshin Impact , and that’s solely due to the many mountainous sub-regions in the area. Players will find themselves constantly going back and forth between teleportation points or spending long minutes scaling the mile-high mountains. This landscape makes it even more difficult when searching for Geoculus, Liyue’s regional Oculi.

Bishui Plain covers Wangshu Inn, Sal Terrae, Dihua Marsh, Wuwang Hill, Stone Gate, and Qingce Village. There are a total of 41 Geoculus that Genshin Impact players can collect here, and they can easily do so by following this easy route.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 1

Your Geoculus route will start at Wangshu Inn, so make sure to have the teleport waypoint at the very top unlocked. Once you’re there, jump off the ledge in front of you, and glide towards the bridge near the water. You’ll find the first oculi underneath it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 2

Teleport back to the Wangshu Inn waypoint, turn around, and head up the stairs inside. Once you reach the deck, climb the roof to find this oculi.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 3

This Geoculus can be a little difficult to find, as it’s located underneath the pathway you take up to Wangshu Inn. Just follow the location indicated on the map, stay close to the cliff, and you should be able to spot it on a wooden support ledge.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 4

Teleport back to the Wangshu Inn waypoint, turn left, and jump off the edge to glide to this oculus. You’ll find it in the air above a rock; you’ll need to activate the wind current to reach it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 5

Teleport to the Statue of Seven at Dihua Marsh and look to your left to spot the Geoculus. It will be on top of chopped tree bark.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 6

From the previous location, turn around and head down the pathway past the Statue of Seven. You’ll see a Geoculus in the air above a rock. You might need help from the Traveler’s Geo skill, so make sure to switch elements before obtaining this one.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 7

From the previous location, turn left and head across the water towards the nearby island. Keep going until you see a Geoculus on top of a hilichurl camp.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 8

Next, head straight from the previous location ( south of the map ) and go up the hill you see in front of you. At the very top will be a tree, and a Geoculus will be located on one of the branches.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 9

From the previous location, head all the way down the hill and towards the small island. The Geoculus here will be trapped in a wind current, so you need to first get to higher ground before gliding over to collect it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 10

For this one, teleport to the waypoint at Sal Terrae and turn around to spot the Geoculus floating above the water near an Abyss Mage. You can either swim over and use a Cryo character to get you across.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 11

Teleport to the waypoint at Stone Gate and turn around to find a tower behind you. Climb up the ladder, and you’ll be able to find a Geoculus inside.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 12

Next, teleport to the waypoint south of Wuwang Hill and turn around to go past the teleport marker. You’ll see this Geoculus suspended in the air, and all you need to do is glide across to grab it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 13

From the previous location, head back up the hill that you teleported onto and glide all the way down to find a circular stone structure. There will be a Geoculus floating above it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 14

Turn left from your previous location and head straight along the shoreline to find this Geoculus underneath the bridge in front of you.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 15

Teleport back to the waypoint south of Wuwang Hill and glide south on the map towards the shoreline. There will be a Geoculus to collect in the distance.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 16

After collecting the previous Geoculus, head left along the shoreline until you reach these rock formations. Climb all the way to the top to grab the Geoculus.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 17

This Geoculus is near the previous one, so all you need to do is follow the map north until you reach some ruins. The Geoculus will be hidden underneath a staircase of sorts.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 18

From the previous position, head straight past the ruins and towards an open area. There will be an enemy in the area, and the Geoculus will be located in this stone frame.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 19

This Geoculus can be found on Wuwang Hill itself, but you need to have the Hidden Palace of Zhou Formula Domain unlocked. Upon teleporting there, head behind it to find a ladder and go up to find some enemies. The Geoculus will be right near them.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 20

After grabbing the previous Geoculus, head left past all the enemies and keep climbing the mountain. You need to use the Traveler’s Geo skill here to help you, as this Geoculus is located at the very top of the hill.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 21

Once you have grabbed the previous Geoculus, jump off the mountain and glide southwest towards this one. It will be located near some enemies.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 22

For this one, you can teleport to the waypoint southeast of Wuwang Hill (the one inside the cave) and then leave the cave through the entrance behind you. Climb the mountain to your right and keep going up until you see the Geoculus. The climb isn’t tough at all since the rocks are small.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 23

Teleport to the waypoint southwest of Qingce Village and head straight along the path to find a Geoculus suspended in the air above a bridge.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 24

This one can be a little tricky to find, as it requires a lot of climbing. Once you grab the Geoculus from the previous location, head straight again towards another bridge, pass that, and then take an immediate left to climb the rocks. Keep going up until you reach a clearing, and you’ll see a Treasure Hoarder camp in the distance.

This Geoculus will actually be located at the very top of these bamboo shoots near the water. Players will need to get to higher ground first before collecting it, as climbing the bamboo shoot is not possible.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 25

From the previous location, you can head straight past the Treasure Hoarder camp and glide down to the shoreline to find this Geoculus located on top of a rock.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 26

Now, teleport to the waypoint west of Qingce Village and head down the path to find a small house. There will be a Geoculus on the roof to collect.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 27

Teleport back to the same waypoint and turn around to head up the hill in front of you. Keep climbing until you reach a shrine and go out the entrance to find a Geoculus floating in the air. You can climb the nearby rock to grab it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 28

Now teleport to the main waypoint at Qingce Village and glide down towards the house you see. The Geoculus will be hidden within the panels.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 29

Teleport back to the same waypoint and turn around to go down the stairs to your left. The Geoculus will be located on the roof of a building, but because it’s pretty hard to get, you’ll need to scale the mountain on your left to gain more height. Once you’re up there, simply glide down towards the spot to grab it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 30

Once you have collected the previous Geoculus, simply head down the village. Once you're halfway down to the stream, you’ll see the next one. It’ll be floating in the air above the flower fields, so use the Geo traveler’s skills to help you.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 31

From the previous location, keep heading down until you reach a bridge. The Geoculus will be right in front, and you can just glide over to grab it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 32

This Geoculus is a slight trek from the one obtained previously. You’ll need to head up the fields and towards a house you see near the cliffs. Go past the house and keep climbing up until you see an NPC named Dandy. There will be a tree right next to her, and the Geoculus will be located on one of the branches.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 33

Next, teleport back to the same waypoint at Qingce Village, turn right, and head towards the wooden pillars you see in the water. In the middle of the biggest one, you’ll find a Geoculus floating.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 34

Teleport back to the waypoint west of Qingce Village and head left past the bridge in front of you. Keep going until you see the Treasure Hoarders and go past them to find a waterfall. Towards the right of the waterfall, you’ll see a tiny hole in the rocks. Inside, you’ll find a Geoculus.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 35

After leaving the previous location, head towards the waterfall until you spot a cave on the right that is covered in vines. This Geoculus will be located above the Ruin Guard, and all you need to do is climb the wall behind it to find it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 36

Once you’ve collected the previous Geoculus, head towards the door and into the underground chamber. This area can only be unlocked after completing the Chi of Guyun World Quest. Once you do, head further into the separate room, and you’ll find the Geoculus floating in the air above the chests. You might need to use the cave walls on the side to help you reach the Geoculus.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 37

Now, teleport to the waypoint to the far west of Bishui Plains and turn right to head towards the Shrine of Depths. The Geoculus will be located in the tree beside it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 38

From the Shrine of Depths in the previous location, glide across the water towards some tree barks, and you’ll see the next Geoculus suspended in the air above one of them.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 39

Teleport back to the same waypoint and head straight down the hill towards the shoreline. This Geoculus will be located above a geo mechanism, so make sure to use the Traveler’s Geo power to grab it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 40

This Geoculus is a slight distance away from the previous one and will require you to run along the shoreline to spot it. It will actually be located above the water, and you’ll need to use the wind current behind you on the cliff to grab it.

Bishui Plain Geoculus Location 41

This final Geoculus is located right next to the previous one. You’ll be able to spot it floating on top of a rock on a small island. You might also need to use the Traveler’s Geo skill to grab it.

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Upcoming Role-Playing Games People Are Excited For
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time
  • Lost Soul Aside
  • Elden Ring: Nightreign
  • Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army
  • Edens Zero
  • Borderlands 4
  • Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
  • Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A
  • Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault
  • Pathologic 3
  • The Witcher 4
  • The Elder Scrolls 6
  • Dragon Quest 12: The Flames Of Fate

Role-playing games have been a staple of the gaming industry for more than three decades. Each month, the genre tends to welcome a couple of noteworthy titles, be it high-profile releases such as Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , Lies of P , Hogwarts Legacy , Octopath Traveler 2 , Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , Baldur's Gate 3 , and Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty, or more niche projects like Labyrinth of Galleria: The Moon Society , 8-Bit Adventures 2 , and Little Witch Nobeta . There are always new RPGs on the horizon.

Due to the ambitious nature of the genre's AAA projects, they are often announced years in advance, a practice that can result in extremely high expectations. Once the hype train gets moving, stopping it can be impossible, which has resulted in some disappointments in the past. However, when a game lives up to its potential, it is a thing of beauty. Which upcoming RPGs are the most sought-after?

Updated May 3, 2025 by Mark Sammut: The article has been updated with the upcoming role-playing game : Edens Zero and Wuchang: Fallen Feathers. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has also been removed.

Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time

RPG Life Sim

14 Images
14 Images
Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time
Life Simulation
RPG
Adventure
Systems
Released
May 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Level 5
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Level-5's Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time has been on a strange journey so far. The game was initially announced as a (seemingly) Switch exclusive with a late 2024 debut; however, it was not only delayed to May 2025 but also announced plans to launch on other systems. Ultimately, this development seems to be for the better as the project will now be available to as many people as possible.

The Girl Who Steals Time is a sequel to the Nintendo 3DS' Fantasy Life , which blends role-playing and life simulation elements. The upcoming RPG seems to be very much cut from the same cloth, delivering a slow-life adventure that incorporates things like fishing, cooking, and combat. Going by the descriptor, Fantasy Life i will feature 14 jobs, which is two more than the original game. More importantly, players can switch between these jobs as they please, rather than tying themselves to one path.

Lost Soul Aside

An Action-Packed JRPG

5 Images
5 Images
Lost Soul Aside
Action RPG
Adventure
JRPG
Systems
Released
May 30, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ultizero Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
Powered by

A console PS5 exclusive that will also be coming to PC, Lost Souls Aside has been steadily building up momentum, paving the way for what will hopefully be a successful launch. An anime aesthetic that is reminiscent of some Final Fantasy games, Ultizero's title follows Kaser, a rebel whose attempt to take down the Empire coincides with the arrival of a meteor that sends his world into chaos. Now, armed with strange powers, he goes on a mission to save both the world and his sister.

While the story's quality will not be known until the game's full release, the combat looks pretty great so far. Lost Souls Aside 's gameplay trailer paints a picture of a fast-paced hack and slash system that incorporates RPG elements via skill progression, weapon variety, and some player choice.

Elden Ring: Nightreign

A Soulslike RPG...With Roguelike And Battle Royale Elements...Open-World Too

8 Images
8 Images
Elden Ring Nightreign
Action RPG
Soulslike
Roguelite
Released
May 30, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
From Software
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PC
Powered by

FromSoftware's track record speaks for itself, particularly when it comes to Souls-style games. Elden Ring is the company's biggest release ever, so it makes sense that FromSoftware would decide to revisit the Lands Between a few more times. "Shadow of the Erdtree" was a generally great expansion, especially for players craving an experience that is considerably harder than the already challenging base game. Compared to that 2024 release, Nightreign is a more surprising project, one that takes Elden Ring in a direction that not many people predicted.

So, what is Nightreign ? Well, it is a lot of things. While playable solo, the standalone game seems to be primarily designed with multiplayer in mind. Players pick a character and are dropped onto a map, where they must defeat enemies and survive for three days. After that point, a main boss will appear, causing players to make a sprint for that fight so they can defeat them before anybody else. Matches are effectively structured like battle royales, with the map getting smaller and the player pool shrinking en route to the final encounter. It is also kind of similar to a roguelike, at least in the sense that each run should be somewhat different.

Nightreign might reduce the original game's RPG elements quite a bit, so the spin-off might not be the best option for players craving an epic adventure in that genre. Still, Elden Ring fans will want to keep an eye on this 2025 release.

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army

A Remaster Of A PS2 JRPG Cult Classic

10 Images
10 Images
RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army
Action
Adventure
RPG
Exploration
Mystery
Systems
Released
June 19, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Atlus
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2, PC, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

An Atlus JRPG always warrants excitement, and the publisher has announced that a remaster of Devil Summoner: Raidou Kuzunoha vs. the Soulless Army , a PS2 title that falls within the same subseries as Soul Hackers , is coming to modern consoles. While good by most metrics, the original game is not one of Atlus' most highly-regarded releases, so Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army 's existence came as something of a surprise. Still, this project should keep players busy, especially those who do not have experience with the 2006 version.

Unlike the turn-based combat that defines most Atlus JRPGs, Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army utilizes real-time combat, so it is a bit of a departure from Persona and Shin Megami Tensei . That said, players will still be able to acquire demons, so that element will be presented.

Edens Zero

Anime Action JRPG Open-World

5 Images
5 Images
Edens Zero
Action RPG
Systems
Released
July 15, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Konami
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

Well, this project came as a bit of a surprise. Hiro Mashima's Edens Zero is a reasonably popular sci-fi shonen manga (and anime), but it is not as famous as the demographic's heavyweights like One Piece or the author's other famous series, Fairy Tail . Yet, this franchise seems set to receive one of the more ambitious gaming adaptations, with Konami's 2025 RPG featuring an open-world that, according to the Steam description, covers a planet. Frankly, the simple fact that Konami is handling the game is shocking in itself.

Edens Zero will feature multiple playable characters, along with extensive customization for each. The combat seems to take a few pages from the Musou blueprint, as most of the available footage showcases the heroes going up against fairly large groups of enemies.

Borderlands 4

Looter-Shooter

Borderlands 4
Looter Shooter
Action
Adventure
RPG
Systems
Released
September 12, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Gearbox Software
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Nintendo Switch 2, PC
Powered by

Gearbox's Borderlands is the definitive looter-shooter franchise, and it does not really have any major challengers. Despite garnering an array of criticisms that might not make them 100% beloved, Borderlands 3 and Tiny Tina's Wonderlands are still fantastic co-op shooters with more than enough RPG elements to satisfy people who want to explore different builds and loadouts. Borderlands 4 is loosely slated for a 2025 release, although very little is known about the sequel at this point. The B4 reveal trailer did not include too much information, and the same can be said for the available concept art.

Despite garnering some criticism for its change in aesthetic, the project is still surrounded by plenty of excitement, simply due to the IP's mostly positive reputation. There are just not all that many alternatives to Borderlands , and the fourth entry will likely be "good" at a minimum.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

Soulslike Action RPG Set During The Ming Dynasty

Your comment has not been saved

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
Action RPG
Soulslike
Systems
Released
2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Leenzee
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

The term "Soulslike" has become so inescapable that its mere mention has to be taken with a grain of salt, as the label is often thrown on any modern action RPG with a dodge roll. However, Wuchang: Fallen Feathers specifically describes itself as Soulslike, so it is aiming to be part of this subgenre. More importantly, the game looks fantastic so far, and in more ways than just the combat.

Dropping players into the Ming Dynasty, Wuchang should bring to life an era that has not been explored all that much by gaming in general, let alone the Soulslike genre. Naturally, a disease spread across the country, leaving behind creative creatures that lean into horror territory in design. The setting is cool, and the incorporation of a named main character is also a nice change of pace from the norm for the genre. The combat has potential, and it seems to take some inspiration from more fast-paced action games.

Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2

Action & Social Sim

Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2
Action RPG
Systems
Released
2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Hardsuit Labs
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines is the definition of a cult classic. While rough around the edges, the RPG features fantastic writing and characters, along with a great deal of customization that provides players with plenty of creative freedom. It is a masterpiece that, for the longest time, seemed destined to remain a solitary project (in the video game industry, anyway); however, in 2019, Bloodlines 2 was revealed to the world. Since then, the game has been pushed back a few times, and information regarding its production has been inconsistent. That said, a few Vampire: The Masquerade spin-offs have debuted over the last few years, so the IP is alive.

Set in Seattle, Bloodlines 2 will let players create a newly transformed vampire, which will involve picking things like their human background and preferred discipline. Vampire: The Masquerade 's success can be partially credited to its deep clan system, which permits players to commit to one of the vampire groups operating in the city. This element should be present in Bloodlines 2 . In terms of gameplay, so far, it seems like the sequel will stick close to its predecessor; therefore, expect first-person action with a heavy focus on a dialogue system.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

The Next Evolution

Your comment has not been saved

Pokemon Legends Z-A
RPG
Systems
Released
2025
ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Game Freak

Platform(s)
Switch
Powered by

Pokemon Legends: Z-A was shrouded in shadows for the longest time, but that changed in February 2025 when a video dropped showcasing the upcoming RPG 's visuals, city, and some gameplay mechanics. Game Freak has confirmed that the project will take place in Kalos, which was introduced during the sixth generation. Similar to 2022's Arceus , one has to assume Z-A takes place well before the events of X and Y .

The game's announcement was mostly greeted with cautious optimism due to Arceus being relatively well-regarded; however, the 2025 video arguably undermined some of that initial hype. That showcase garnered a fairly negative reception, with criticisms being leveled at the empty city, Pokemon starters, and graphics.

Despite growing concerns, Pokemon Legends: Z-A is still one of the most highly-anticipated 2025 RPGs . Why? Well, it is Pokemon .

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault

A Shop Keeper Who Loves Action RPGs

Your comment has not been saved

Moonlighter 2: The Endless Vault
RPG
Open-World
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Digital Sun
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

A charming indie action RPG that emphasizes shop management, Moonlighter is not only very fun but also offers quite a bit of replay value. The 2018 release was successful enough that a sequel always seemed likely, especially since the concept certainly had room to grow. Fortunately, Digital Sun seems set to return to this universe, once again casting players as Will, a shopkeeper who needs to keep his inventory stocked by going out in the wild and collecting loot.

Moonlighter 2 's biggest change is the switch to a full 3D presentation, albeit presented from an isometric angle. While its predecessor's pixel art is top-notch, the sequel should be a pretty substantial upgrade in terms of visuals and presentation. Beyond that, players will get to explore a new area, Tresna, while helping a struggling village to flourish.

Pathologic 3

A Horror-Fueled Journey

Your comment has not been saved

Pathologic 3
Adventure
Horror
RPG
Systems
Released
2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ice-Pick Lodge
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Pathologic is not for everyone. The series is known for cryptic storytelling, ambiguous characters, purposefully frustrating mechanics, and nightmarish world design that can be genuinely unsettling. In other words, Pathologic is a wonderful but acquired taste. The third entry's announcement came as a surprise since its concept was originally planned to be the Bachelor route of Pathologic 2 , the final step in that game's episodic-style release cycle.

Now, to be clear, Pathologic 3 appears set to expand greatly on the route, offering an experience that should hopefully justify its standalone presentation. Even if Pathologic 2 is not quite as highly regarded as its predecessor, both games are very good, and there is nothing to suggest their successor will fail to maintain that high standard. Horror RPGs are extremely rare, so this series should be cherished.

The Witcher 4

Action & Open-World (Presumably)

The Witcher 4
Action RPG
Open-World
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Engine
Unreal Engine 5
Franchise
The Witcher
Powered by

CD Projekt Red has been working on a new The Witcher project for a few years, but the developer did not confirm that it would be the next mainline entry in the saga until The Game Awards 2024. The Witcher 4 is on the horizon, and it is an exciting time to be a fan of open-world RPGs or just games in general. While Cyberpunk 2077 's debut state reduced CD Projekt Red's public goodwill, the developer's post-launch commitment helped right a few of those initial wrongs, and the game is nowadays in good shape. More importantly, The Witcher 3 is still largely regarded as one of the greatest Western RPGs of all time, and time has done very little to dull its shine.

As the previous entry's DLC nicely completed Geralt's story, it had long been speculated that The Witcher 4 would feature a new protagonist, and Ciri has always been the most obvious pick. Well, The Game Awards' trailer largely confirmed that rumor, with the powerful character being front and center. At this point, almost nothing is known about the sequel's direction, except for Ciri seeming to be a few years older than in Wild Hunt . Also, Geralt will likely make an appearance in The Witcher 4 .

The Elder Scrolls 6

Open-World (Presumably)

The Elder Scrolls 6
RPG
Systems
Released
2026
ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios

Platform(s)
PC, Xbox (Original)
Powered by

It was only a matter of time before The Elder Scrolls 6 was revealed, although that is essentially all that Bethesda has done. Except for some minor details that can be surmised from the few seconds of footage that has been released so far, the game is still largely a mystery; however, TES 6 is one of those upcoming RPGs that only needs to exist to generate hype.

Realistically, Bethesda's sequel is still a few years away from a debut, and the publisher will probably not start to heavily market the project until after Starfield 's cycle is complete. Nevertheless, it would be shocking if TES 6 does not wind up as one of the best-selling games of all time.

Dragon Quest 12: The Flames Of Fate

Turn-Based (Presumably)

Dragon Quest 12: The Flames of Fate
JRPG
ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix

Powered by

Dragon Quest 12 is a weird one. Since being revealed in 2021, Square Enix has barely uttered a word regarding the next mainline entry in the storied JRPG franchise. Dragon Quest 's influence and popularity cannot be understated, particularly in Japan where the series is nothing short of a cultural phenomenon. While there was a fairly long dry spell after DQ8 , the 11th mainline entry was a hit in Western countries, elevating the license to international highs it had not experienced for a while. Thanks to its predecessor's success, Dragon Quest 12 is poised to be one of the biggest releases in the license's history outside of Japan.

Perhaps, Square Enix announced DQ12 's existence a bit prematurely or simply wanted to gauge the public's interest in a sequel; whatever the reason, the post-reveal silence has lasted slightly too long. Hopefully, the publisher will expand on the game's development at some point in the near future as the gaming world is ready for a new mainline Dragon Quest adventure.

item.title: Clair Obscur Expedition 33: Best Characters To Give Lumina Points, Ranked
item.description:
When playing through Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 for the first time, it is important to not only have a good understanding of how certain game mechanics function but also how best to utilize the party in the most effective way. Every member of the team has value and can certainly bring a lot to a fight, but there are for sure some characters that shine more than others, whether through their damage numbers or supportive capabilities.

Lumina points are an important part of a build that greatly decides how each member plays in an encounter, augmenting their damage output, defensive capabilities, as well as bringing a few extra tools to the fray that can turn the tide in the player's favor in a matter of seconds. The points are precious and should be spent according to which members can make the most of the added abilities and who can truly excel as the master expeditioner.

6 Gustave

Not Enough To Offer

Gustave is a pretty fun character that can bring some serious power with the right combination of Luminas, but suffers from a lack of skills that get quickly outshone by his fellow party members. The investment in his Lumina count can be useful in ramping up the Overcharge burst potential but with a pretty basic set of attacks to choose from, he leaves a lot to be desired.

In NG+, once the player has access to later Pictos like Painted Power, the player can quickly transform him into a pretty decent damage threat. With that being said, the main problem with his kit is the limitations and lack of diversity it provides, which can get quite boring after a while, and players are better off spending those well-earned points on another character who has access to a wider arsenal of attacks and supportive abilities.

5 Sciel

A Slow Build-up With An Average Payoff

Sciel is a very interesting character that can be used as a significant damage dealer against the majority of the threats in the world. The main benefit to her playstyle is against bosses where the fight goes long and players need quite a few turns to take them down, so having someone in the party who can build up stacks and unleash a big burst of damage all at once, can be pretty valuable and lead to some insane damage numbers with the right Luminas.

Simple Luminas like Energizing Start can be invaluable and beginning the stacking early and the other mechanic in her kit related to Twilight, is important to acquire quickly and maintain for maximum damage output, so having extra Luminas to allow her to take a second turn or have additional speed, can be useful in maintaining the darkness. With all tha said, she can be a bit inconsistent, as other characters can normally dispatch threats before she even has a chance to fully stack her up damage up, but she still has a lot of power and can be a fun character to experiment with and try new builds.

4 Monoco

Versatility Unlike Any Other

Monoco is probably the most interesting character in the whole game, as his skills are directly tied to taking down specific enemies across the entire map. He isn't limited to one playstyle or one strategy and can slot into basically any team and any role, however the player chooses and depending on the slot that needs to be filled to create a rounded party.

Versatility is great and all but his overall power level is definitely weaker than some of the other options, as being a jack-of-all-trades may come with some flexibility, but specific achetypes are better served with a different character and anything he does bring to the table is more of a fun gimmick, even with the extra Lumina points. While he does bring some okay power in the damage and support departments, it still leaves a lot to be desired and the experimentation normally ends at the conclusion that the party slot should go to someone else.

3 Lune

The Queen Of Support And Elemental Destruction

In terms of a core party member that most teams will want to have around, Lune fits the bill perfectly, bringing some pretty high elemental damage along with the best supportive kit in the game that can not only buff and heal, but also resurrect fallen teammates and quickly switch back to damage in a matter of moments. Adding Lumina points to her can open the doors for so many possibilities, like extra turns to pump out more heals, or additional spell-casts that can deal insane AOE damage and tick for even more turns to come.

In the later stages of the game, even experienced players make mistakes, and damage is almost a guarantee. Being able to reliably heal through the punishment and return fire with some devastaing blows, makes Lune a valuable asset to a strong part and with additional tools thanks to the Lumina slots, the mage is truly unlocked and given all the resources she could ever need to both carry and support.

2 Verso

Style And Sustain All In One

Style says it all with Verso. His main mechanic is directly tied to building up a Devil May Cry grade system that adds extra damage and effects to all his attacks and abilities. The problem is that upon taking damage, that progress can be reversed quite quickly, so investing heavily into his Lumina pool can allow him to build up the style all the way to S in just a few turns and maintain it thanks to damage avoidance Luminas and defensive mechanics.

He can really make use of those extra slots by gaining extra AP on dodges, to cast higher cost spells that boost the style immensely and with one of the strongest Gradient Attacks for damage, a Lumina like Gradient Fighter, lets the player unleash a oneshotting burst that fully utilizes everything in Verso's kit, as well the additional slots to full effect.

1 Maelle

The Leading Lady In A Team Of Greats

Insanely strong and just as cool, Maelle is arguably the best character in the whole game and hence giving her extra tools and damage modifiers seems like the perfect reason to spend the extra Lumina on upgrading her. The ability to deal extra damage at the start of a fight, or sustain through far more damage, lets the player really control the pace of the fight and hence manage her stances with greater efficiency and effect.

Also, her second Gradient Attack allows her to revive the entire team at once, which can be an absurdly powerful tool at the end of the game, so Luminas like Second Chance that keep her in the fight for longer or extra tools that keep her alive for longer, allows the player to build up the meter faster and basically guarantee victory in any fight so long as Maelle is still alive.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: 8 Strongest Sages In Final Fantasy, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Sages excel in magical stats, proficient in Black and White Magic, but lack in physical stats.
  • Tellah is a once-great Sage who struggles in Final Fantasy 4 due to age and memory loss.
  • Final Fantasy games offer powerful Sage characters like Leonora and Sophia for magic combat.

Sages are a souped-up version of the Red Mage with all their points invested in magical stats. This makes them adept at using both Black and White Magic, although it comes at the cost of their physical stats being downright abysmal.

Players who don't mind a risky party makeup will love putting a Sage in their party to enjoy the best of both worlds. As long as they're protected from any hard-hitting physical attacks, Sages can be a nightmare for enemies at high levels in their respective Final Fantasy games.

8 Tellah

Way Past His Prime By The Time He Joins The Party

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 4
7.0 /10
Released
July 19, 1991

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Square
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, SNES, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, PS1, PC, Switch, PS4
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Tellah may have been a great Sage in his prime, but this isn't the version of the character that fans see in Final Fantasy 4 . Instead, what they see is an old, frail man who has lost his memories and must regain his mastery over magic from the ground up.

While he eventually gains access to several powerful spells, Tellah is way past his prime. This is reflected in the fact that his MP pool stagnates at 80, meaning that he doesn't even have the strength to use Meteor despite re-learning this spell.

7 The Nu Mou

The Only Race Capable Of Being A Sage In The Final Fantasy Tactics Series

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy Tactics Advance
Tactical RPG
Systems

September 8, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Square Product Development Division 4
Platform(s)
Nintendo Game Boy Advance
Powered by

Final Fantasy Tactics was a relatively mature experience, but the sequels on portable hardware leaned toward a different direction. These games dealt with isekai plots and charming settings that were clearly geared towards children.

However, that should take nothing away from Final Fantasy Tactics Advance and its sequel, which boast compelling strategic gameplay and a fun job system. Players who recruit members of the Nu Mou race in their party can turn them into Sages, allowing players to enjoy a powerful spellcaster who can win fights as long as players protect them at all times.

6 Leonora

A Versatile Sage Who's Useful Despite Her Physical Weakness

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 4: The After Years
JRPG
Systems
Released
June 1, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Square Enix, Matrix Software
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, PSP, Wii
Powered by

Final Fantasy 4: The After Years is a fun sequel that sees both new and returning characters join hands to tackle yet another threat. A new face in this sequel is an Epopt trainee named Leonora, who is being mentored by Palom to learn Black Magic.

This, coupled with her mastery of White Magic, places her on the path to becoming a Sage. She pretty much confirms that she wants to grow up and be a strong magician like Tellah, following in the footsteps of this legendary Sage.

5 Sophia

A Party Member Who Can Learn The Sage Job

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin
7 /10

March 18, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Platform(s)

OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin allows players to tackle dungeons with Jack and his friends, who go on a tear throughout these regions and cut down bigger enemies to size. One of Jack's allies is Sophia, a powerful warrior who can use the Sage job in combat.

Players must complete the quest Ebon Memories: The Tragic Cynic to gain access to this job for Sophia. She can become a powerful magic caster in combat once the Sage job is unlocked, enhancing the options players have in combat against tough foes.

4 Fusoya

One Of The Few Good Lunarians And A Very Powerful Sage

  • Final Fantasy 4

Fusoya is one of the most mysterious characters in the series, introduced as one of the few peaceful Lunarians who doesn't want humanity to die off. He gives Cecil and his friends the guidance they need to tackle Zemus and beat this powerful foe for good.

Fusoya is only at the party for a brief time, but makes a substantial impact by showcasing his mastery over both white and black magic. He basically operates as a late-game Sage with immense magical power who will wow players with his abilities.

3 Warrior Of Light

Final Fantasy 14's Protagonist Can Learn And Master The Art Of Being A Sage

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 14
11
9.5 /10
Released
August 27, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Language, Mild Blood, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PC, macOS, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

Final Fantasy 14 turned from a buggy MMO into one of the most popular games in the genre that fans can't get enough of. Yoshi-P's reputation in the industry has expanded simply because of the work he put into reviving this game and making it worthy of the Final Fantasy name.

The game lets players take on several jobs, including that of a Sage. Soloing as this class is easier said than done, but that should take nothing away from the Sage's power as players gain access to several powerful Final Fantasy spells that both heal foes and harm enemies.

2 Jack Garland

The Protagonist Can Assume Almost Every Job In The Series, And The Sage Is No Exception

  • Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin

Jack Garland is one of the most divisive characters in the Final Fantasy series, with his edgy attitude making it easy to laugh at scenes that are meant to be deadly serious. However, as weird as his personality may be, Jack's skills in combat speak for themselves.

He can use any job in the game, including the Sage. Watching him whiz around the arena in his white robes and unleash high-level magic on his foes never ceases to be entertaining.

1 Luneth, Arc, Refia, And/Or Ingus

The Warriors Of Light Can Become Incredibly Powerful Sages

Final Fantasy 3 was the first game in the series to introduce a Sage, with players being able to maximize this job's abilities if they prioritize it for a character. The Sage has weak physical stats, but its magical capabilities are through the roof.

In a well-balanced party, this job can shine against tough foes and intimidating bosses. Players should be aware to protect any Sage character from physical damage if they don't want their magical powerhouse to fall in battle after a single hit.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Players Shouldn’t Skip This Lovecraftian Quest
item.description:
Summary

  • Oblivion Remastered features unique quests in various locations, including a small, unnerving town with cosmic horror themes.
  • Bethesda incorporates nods to H.P. Lovecraft in their games, adding depth and mystery to familiar aspects like the Aedra and Daedra.
  • A Shadow Over Hackdirt quest in Oblivion Remastered draws inspiration from Lovecraft's "The Shadow Over Innsmouth," offering a memorable and eerie experience.

Oblivion Remastered takes players to many different, memorable, and strange locations for its quests. From Cyrodiil’s unique cities to haunting Ayleid ruins, even to the realms of the Daedra themselves, there are plenty of places to get lost in Oblivion Remastered . But one, seemingly mundane place, is a small town off the beaten path, lost in the woods, with some deep, Lovecraftian themes.

Bethesda has been putting nods to H.P. Lovecraft in many of its recent games, such as the evolving mythos of Fallout ’s Dunwich Borers. The Aedra and Daedra in The Elder Scrolls are beloved aspects of the franchise, but sometimes, something unknowable is needed to shed new light on mysteries about the gods that some players take for granted. But beware, the Brethren have taken notice, and it is time to delve deep into Hackdirt.

A Shadow Over Hackdirt Is Oblivion Remastered’s Nod to Cosmic Horror

Players shopping at Northern Goods and Trade in Chorrol may be asked to rescue Dar-Ma, a missing Argonian girl, who was last seen heading for Hackdirt. When they wander south of Chorrol, expecting to find an ordinary town, there is instead something far more eerie awaiting them. Broken down ruins, boarded up buildings, and a town that seems swallowed up by the forest looms out of the trees.

Something is definitely wrong with the town, but something is even more wrong with the locals. They will be immediately distrustful, warning the player that they don’t like outsiders. Even the Hero of Kvatch is greeted by a sneer. Asking questions about the town will reveal very little about the place, other than it was attacked some time ago, and asking about the Brethren will result in some warnings of very dire consequences.

Hackdirt's Unsettling Nature Runs Deep

Bethesda took a lot of care in making Hackdirt feel hostile, as the merchants will have unique lines of dialogue just for buying and selling, accusing you of cheating them. Their disposition toward the player will be very low, and while it can be improved, it will never have a meaningful effect. The houses that remain intact are incredibly disorganized, with broken, moldy crates littering rooms, pictures hanging at strange angles, and mysterious trapdoors in the floor. The strangest behavior, though, is how NPCs will follow the player around Hackdirt, keeping their distance, but always within sight, adding a subtle sense of dread to the town.

Investigating Dar-Ma’s whereabouts will lead to many blank expressions, with characters insisting they have never heard of her, but with both her horse in town and her diary, it’s a difficult story to believe. However, Jiv Hiriel will help the player, inviting them to meet him after dark to spill the town’s secrets. But no one else will offer any cooperation, and sleeping at the inn will end up in a rude awakening as one of the Hackdrit Brethren will attack the player in their room. But the biggest way to get on the bad side of Hackdirt’s suspicious residents is by taking one of the trapdoors to the tunnels below the village, and finding out what goes on below.

How a Shadow Over Hackdirt Puts a Spin on Lovecraft’s “The Shadow Over Innsmouth”

Lovecraft fans will immediately notice the similarities between Hackdirt and Lovecraft’s “The Shadow Over Innsmouth.” In the short story, an investigator goes to Innsmouth, a largely forgotten seaside town with strange locals and a very unfriendly atmosphere. He finds out that the town had been attacked on multiple occasions, as well as suffered from a mysterious plague, noting that some of the people look strangely inhuman.

After meeting someone who wasn’t a local, the narrator is encouraged to speak to the town drunk, Zadok, who tells him how Innsmouth changed when Obed Marsh began a practice of ritual sacrifice to appease the mysterious Deep Ones. He explained how humans coupling with Deep Ones would produce children that looked normal, but would steadily turn into Deep Ones in adulthood, yearning to return to the deep seas. When Marsh’s rituals got townspeople arrested, the Deep Ones took out their fury on the residents in displeasure.

As the tales become more absurd, the narrator brushes it all off as the ravings of a drunk, who warns him they are being watched, but he takes no notice. When he is forced to spend the night in the town, the narrator is woken up to someone frantically attempting to break into his room, so he escapes. Having recognized that the entire town of Innsmouth is now looking for him, he escapes by road, but comes across a sight he could never have believed.

A Shadow Over Hackdirt Isn’t the Only Time Bethesda Has Paid Homage to Lovecraft

Without spoiling the end of either, the parallels between Lovecraft’s story and the Oblivion Remastered quest are very clear. Bethesda is paying homage to the popular cosmic horror writer, making for an incredibly memorable location that could be so easily missed by players, and this isn’t the only time the developer has made such overt references.

Bethesda has been known to make a lot of references to Lovecraftian horror, particularly in the Fallout series. Beginning with the Dunwich Building in Fallout 3 , Bethesda has built up a narrative around strange, cyclopean entities, far older and more powerful than humans can imagine, whose roots in civilization go back way before the Great War. The studio built upon this with the Dunwich Borers quarry in Fallout 4 , and even the Cabot House quest line into ancient alien artifacts. Even Fallout 76 has had its share of cosmic influences, and the question is up in the air about what The Elder Scrolls 6 might add to deepen any Lovecraftian connections.

A Shadow Over Hackdirt is a quest worth experiencing for any Oblivion Remastered player, and those left curious by it should also read the story that inspired it. The game is full of plenty of fascinating quests like it, so in between the Dark Brotherhood and the Mages Guild, players should make some time for Hackdirt.

6 Images
6 Images
